Key Match Events: Phoenix went on a 25-6 run in the third quarter, turning a seven-point deficit into a 12-point lead that was too much for Philadelphia to overcome.
Pre-Game Insights: Phoenix coach Mike Budenholzer took longtime starters Bradley Beal and Jusuf Nurkic out of the lineup and had them come off the bench.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns ended a four-game skid with a 109-99 win over the Philadelphia 76ers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns bench outscored Philadelphia's reserves 54-7.
The Suns shot 14-for-30 (46.7%) from beyond the arc, led by three 3s each from Durant, Beal and Dunn.
Others: Tyrese Maxey had 31 points and 10 assists for the Sixers, who were missing Joel Embiid, who was sidelined with a left foot sprain.
